snippet: The California Senate approved a package of bills over the weekend that is expected to result in big changes in the state's utilities and eventually promote head-to-head competition.    The package goes to Governor Pete Wilson, who is expected to ...
lead_paragraph: The California Senate approved a package of bills over the weekend that is expected to result in big changes in the state's utilities and eventually promote head-to-head competition. The package goes to Governor Pete Wilson, who is expected to sign it. The State Assembly, the other house of the legislature, passed the bills on Friday evening.
abstract: California Senate approves deregulation legislation to give customers option of buying power from statewide pool, or keeping existing arrangements with local utilities; significant rate cuts are envisioned by year 2002 (S)
